Package protocol.servers

Class LocalNode

java.lang.Object
protocol.servers.LocalNode
public class LocalNode extends Object
Class that represents the local node. Entity responsible for coordinating the communication between the central node and client

    Method

    int
    clientsConnected()
    Function to get the number of clients connected to the local node

    listenForCentralNodeResponse()
    Function that loops while this local node is connected to the central node, receiving packets from the central node and then sending them to the respective/s client/s

    Function that loops while the server socket isn't closed and accepts new connections

    mostEmpty()
    Function that checks if this local node is the node with fewer clients

    Function that loops while this local node is connected to the central node, receiving packets from the clients and then sending them to the central node

  • Method Details

    • startServer

      public void startServer​(int port, String centralNodeHost, int centralNodePort)
      Function that starts the local node
      Parameters:
      port - the port where local node clients will connect to
      centralNodeHost - the central node host so that the local node can establish a connection with the central node
      centralNodePort - the central node port so that the local node can establish a connection with the central node

      Function to shut down the server

      Function to get the number of clients connected to the local node
      Returns:
      the number of clients connected to the local node

    • mostEmpty

      public boolean mostEmpty()
      Function that checks if this local node is the node with fewer clients
      Returns:
      true if this local node is the node with fewer clients otherwise false

    • listenForConnection

      public void listenForConnection()
      Function that loops while the server socket isn't closed and accepts new connections

      public void listenForCentralNodeResponse()
      Function that loops while this local node is connected to the central node, receiving packets from the central node and then sending them to the respective/s client/s

      public void sendPacketsToCentralNode()
      Function that loops while this local node is connected to the central node, receiving packets from the clients and then sending them to the central node
